intro: Dieteria canescens var. sessiliflora, commonly known as the sessile-flowered dieteria, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a compact inflorescence. It is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its botanical structure reflects adaptations to its arid environment, with reduced leaves and a compact growth form.
